;2 No bleed

;6 Wrong color mode
;CMYK colors are employed in the printing world, while all scanned images and digital photographs are in RGB mode. For that reason all images need to be converted to CMYK mode. You may uncover slight variations in colors whenever you do so as well as the image can then be adjusted to your liking.
;
;7 Color matching
;It can be a common misconception which you can take a printout from your house printer and have the finished product matched exactly to it. A commercial press is calibrated differently from inkjet or laser printer. As a result it is impossible to match colors exactly like it. The most effective practice is to have a tough copy proof produced from the press and subsequently the artist can adjust the colors on the art files.
;
;8 Color matching in between label and booklets
;Even in the event you use exactly the same color on both the label and booklet, they are going to in no way come out to be exactly the same. It can be simply because the supplies on the booklet and label cause the same color to reflect differently. The top you can do to make certain the highest degree of accuracy is to use a Pantone color on each label and booklet.
;
;9 Silkscreen vs Offset printing on labels
;With offset printing on labels becoming more widespread nowadays, many would think offset may be the best way to do label printing. But the answer ought to be dependent on the type of artwork. If your artwork consists of mostly solid shapes, lines, text and no graduate fade of colors, silkscreen will provide you with crisp and sharp disc labels. However, photographic images appear ideal on offset printing. Keep in mind that silkscreen artwork demands the use of spot colors, which is mostly set up on Illustrator and Quark. Procedure colors on silkscreen outcomes in a poor look on the disc label. It really is suggested that should you be not familiar with spot color setup to solicit support from a professional graphic designer.
